ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned so much about witchcraft in Puritan New England I had a lot of misconceptions coming into the course (burning at the stake! water dunking test!) which were very quickly cleared up. I also learned how to properly analyze historical documents and not take them necessarily at face value (understanding the context they occurred in, potential biases, etc.)
I learned a lot about analyzing historical documents.

I will never look at witchcraft in movies, books, etc. the same. I am so much more critical of representations of witchcraft and witch-hunts, as well as just Puritan culture in general, as a result of taking this class. I feel like an expert on the topic now!

This course offers an in-depth look at colonial New England. The subject of witchcraft allowed us to discuss religion, gender, and politics. We looked at different historical interpretations of the same issue as well as different methodological approaches to studying one issue. For instance, we analyzed historians' use of psychology and sociology.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: She made the class very fun.
The level of involvement with primary sources was a great strength of this class. The discussions were also unusual in how engaging, interesting and fun they were.

Tannenbaum is an incredible professor and a joy to have a seminar with every week. The course readings are a bit daunting (nearly read a whole book each week), but they were well-selected for the course. Absolutely loved this course!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: TAKE THIS COURSE. Professor Tannenbaum is wonderful and the readings are great. You will learn so much and have a great time doing it.
Absolutely take it if you are at all interested in witchcraft, Puritans, or early New England society.

Take this course! Prof. Tannenbaum is an excellent professor and the subject of witchcraft is fascinating. You'll never be bored in class discussions and you'll learn a lot about colonial America and early New England towns - and New Haven!
The most fun class I've taken so far at Yale. Class conversation flowed easily and interwove with the course readings. Very interesting and engaging.
Yes. Everything about this course is great. Must take this course if you have even a little bit of interest in this topic.

Yes! This is a great history seminar if you want to dive into a subject. We spent a lot of time with primary sources and discussions were always thought-provoking. Witchcraft is so fascinating for thinking about gender and religion and Professor Tannenbaum does a great job of bringing in the modern day relevance of the subject.
